clinical_study.brief_title: Post-market Evaluation of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows in Spine Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Post-market Evaluation of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows Performance and Safety in Spine Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, multi-center, multi-national post-market study evaluating the performance and safety HEMOBLAST™ Bellows in spine surgery

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective, multi-center, multi-national post-market study evaluating the performance and safety HEMOBLAST™ Bellows in spine surgery. Up to 80 subjects will be enrolled at up to 6 sites.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperatively, expected within 3-10 minutes of application
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects for which hemostasis was achieved after application of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Serious Adverse Device Effects (SADEs)
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of occurrence of serious adverse events deemed by the Investigator to be possibly, probably, or definitely related to HEMOBLAST™ Bellows

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperative, prior to surgical closure of the subject
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of target bleeding site re-bleeding after hemostasis has been achieved with HEMOBLAST™ Bellows

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-operatively, expected within 1-28 days of the surgical procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of re-operation due to post-operative bleeding/hemorrhage after treatment with HEMOBLAST™ Bellows

intervention.description: Surgeon has chosen to use HEMOBLAST™ Bellows as an adjunct to hemostasis when control of minimal, mild, or moderate bleeding by conventional procedures is ineffective or impractical in spine surgery.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects undergoing spine surgery that meet all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria
